data.title: Kings of Iberia (Spain and Portugal)
data.text:
Kings of Iberia (Spain and Portugal)

[Pedigrees][Contents][Bottom][Notables][Surnames][Index][Aliases][References][Home][Mail]

Here I show how I am related to the kings and queens of Iberia. I have also made five generation pedigree charts for many of the kings. [Pedigrees]

The information on the chronology of kings in Iberia comes from the following site:

Iberia: Spain & Portugal

That site also has similiar information on kings of many other countries back to ancient times.

Kings of Iberia (Spain and Portugal)

Aragon

Asturias

Barcelona

Castile

Galicia

Leon

Navarre

Portugal

Sobrarbre

Spain

ARAGON

717-c850 To the Caliphate c850-1035 To Navarre JIMENEZ 1035-1063 Ramiro I Ramiro I de Aragon (-1064)[Pedigree] great(28) grand father 1063-1094 Sancho Sancho Ramirez I de Aragon (V de Navarre) (1042-1094)[Pedigree] great(27) grand father 1094-1104 Peter I Pedro I of Aragon and Navarre (1069-1104)[Pedigree] great(27) uncle through their ancestor Sancho Ramirez I de Aragon (V de Navarre) King of Aragon (1042-1094). 1104-1134 Alphonse the Battler Alfonso I of Aragon (-1134)[Pedigree] not directly related. 1134-1137 Ramiro II the Monk (-1147) Ramiro II "the Monk" de Aragon (1075-1157)[Pedigree] great(26) grand father 1137-1163 Petronilla (-1173) Petronilla de Aragon (1135-1173)[Pedigree] great(25) grand mother BARCELONA 1163-1196 Alphonse II the Chaste Alfonso II Raimundez (1152-1196)[Pedigree] great(24) grand father 1196-1213 Peter II Pedro II de Aragon-Catalonia (1176-1213)[Pedigree] great(24) grand father 1213-1276 James I the Conqueror Jaime I "the Conqueror" de Aragon (1207-1276)[Pedigree] great(23) grand father 1276-1285 Peter III the Great Pedro III "the Great" of Aragon (1236-1285)[Pedigree] great(23) uncle through their ancestor Jaime I "the Conqueror" de Aragon King of Aragon (1207-1276). 1285-1291 Alphonse III the Do-Gooder Alfonso III "el Liberal" of Aragon (1265-1291)[Pedigree] first cousin 23 times removed through their ancestor Jaime I "the Conqueror" de Aragon King of Aragon (1207-1276). 1291-1327 James II the Just Jaime II of Aragon (1267-1327)[Pedigree] first cousin 23 times removed through their ancestor Jaime I "the Conqueror" de Aragon King of Aragon (1207-1276). 1327-1336 Alphonse IV the Good Alfonso IV "el Benigne" of Aragon (1299-1336)[Pedigree] first cousin 22 times removed through their ancestor Charles II of Naples King of Naples (-1309). 1336-1387 Peter IV the Ceremonious Pedro IV "the Ceremonious" of Aragon (1319-1387)[Pedigree] second cousin 21 times removed through their ancestor Charles II of Naples King of Naples (-1309). 1387-1395 John I Juan I "el Cazador" of Aragon (1350-1396)[Pedigree] third cousin 20 times removed through their ancestor Charles II of Naples King of Naples (-1309). 1395-1410 Martin the Humane Martin I "el Humano" of Aragon (1356-1410)[Pedigree] third cousin 20 times removed through their ancestor Charles II of Naples King of Naples (-1309). 1410-1412 (Interregnum) TRASTAMARA 1412-1416 Ferdinand I the Just Fernando I "the Just" of Aragon and Sicily (1380-1416)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 19 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1416-1458 Alphonse V the Magnanimous Alfonso V "el Magnanimo" of Aragon (1394-1458)[Pedigree] fifth cousin 18 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1458-1479 John II Juan_II of Aragon and Navarre (1398-1479)[Pedigree] fifth cousin 18 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1479-1516 Ferdinand II the Catholic Fernando II of Aragon (1452-1516)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 13 times removed through their ancestor Diego Gomez (Suarez) de Toledo Alcalde of Toledo (1334-). United with Castile to form Spain

ASTURIAS

PELAYEZ (ALARIC) 718-737 Pelayo Pelayo of Asturias (-737)[Pedigree] second cousin 35 times removed through their ancestor Swinthila King of West Goths (-633). 737-739 Favila Favila of Asturias (-739)[Pedigree] third cousin 34 times removed through their ancestor Swinthila King of West Goths (-633). PEREZ 739-757 Alphonse I Alfonso I "el Catolico" of Asturias and Galicia [Pedigree] great(34) uncle through their ancestor Pedro de Cantabria Duque de Cantabria. 757-768 Fruela I Fruela I of Asturias (740-)[Pedigree] first cousin 34 times removed through their ancestor Pedro de Cantabria Duque de Cantabria. 768-774 Aurelius Aurelio I of Asturias [Pedigree] great(33) uncle through their ancestor Fruela of Cantabria Duque of Cantabria (-765). 774-783 Silo Silo I of Asturias (-783)[Pedigree] not directly related. 783-788 Mauregato Maugerato I of Asturias [Pedigree] first cousin 34 times removed through their ancestor Pedro de Cantabria Duque de Cantabria. 788-791 Bermudo I the Deacon Vermudo I "el Diacano" of Asturias (750-797)[Pedigree] great(32) grand father 791-842 Alphonse II the Chaste Alfonso II "el Casto" of Asturias (765-842)[Pedigree] second cousin 33 times removed through their ancestor Pedro de Cantabria Duque de Cantabria. 842-850 Ramiro I Ramiro I of Asturias (790-850)[Pedigree] great(31) grand father 850-866 Ordono I Ordono I of Asturias and Galicia (830-866)[Pedigree] great(30) grand father 866-910 Alphonse III the Great Alfonso III "el Magno" of Asturias (848-910)[Pedigree] great(33) grand father 910-925 Fruela II the Cruel Fruela II "el Leproso" of Leon (875-925)[Pedigree] great(33) uncle through their ancestor Alfonso III "el Magno" of Asturias King of Asturias, Galicia, and Leon (848-910). 925-931 Alphonse IV the Monk Alfonso IV "el Monje" of Asturias (899-933)[Pedigree] great(32) uncle through their ancestor Ordono II of Asturias King of Asturias, Leon, and Galicia (873-924). 931-950 Ramiro II Ramiro II of Asturias (900-951)[Pedigree] great(31) grand father 950-955 Ordono III Ordono III of Leon (926-955)[Pedigree] great(30) grand father 955-958 Sancho the Fat (-966) Sancho I of Leon (-966)[Pedigree] great(31) uncle through their ancestor Ramiro II of Asturias King of Asturias (900-951). 958-960 Ordono IV the Wicked Ordono IV "el Malo" of Leon (926-962)[Pedigree] first cousin 32 times removed through their ancestor Sancho I Garces of Navarre & Pamplona King of Navarre and Pamplona (865-925). 960-966 Sancho the Fat (restored) 967-982 Ramiro III (-984) Ramiro III Flavio [Pedigree] first cousin 31 times removed through their ancestor Ramiro II of Asturias King of Asturias (900-951). 982-999 Bermudo II Vermudo II "el Gotoso" of Leon (953-999)[Pedigree] great(29) grand father 999-1028 Alphonse V Alfonso V of Leon (994-1028)[Pedigree] great(28) grand father 1028-1037 Bermudo III Bermudo III of Leon (-1037)[Pedigree] great(28) uncle through their ancestor Alfonso V of Leon King of Leon (994-1028). To Castile thereafter

BARCELONA

717-801 To the Caliphate 801-1137 To France BARCELONA 873-898 Wifred the Hairy Wifredo I "the Hairy" of Barcelona (-897)[Pedigree] great(30) grand father 898-914 Borel I 914-940 Sunyer Suniario I of Barcelona (878-950)[Pedigree] great(29) grand father 940-992 Borel II Borrel II de Barcelona (946-992)[Pedigree] great(28) grand father 940-966 with Miro (in Urgel) 922-1018 Raymond Borel Ramon Borrel I of Barcelona (972-1017)[Pedigree] great(27) grand father 1018-1035 Berengar Raymond I the Hunchback Berenguer Raymond I "el Curvo" de Barcelone (1005-1035)[Pedigree] great(27) grand father 1035-1076 Raymond Berengar I the Old Ramon Berenger I "El Viejo" of Barcelona (1023-1076)[Pedigree] great(27) grand father 1076-1082 Raymond Berengar II Burlap-head Ramon Berenger II "Cabeza de Estope" of Barcelona (1053-1082)[Pedigree] great(26) grand father 1076-1097 with Berengar Raymond II the Fratracide 1086-1131 with Raymond Berengar III the Great Ramon Berenger III of Barcelona (1080-1131)[Pedigree] great(25) grand father 1131-1162 Raymond Berengar IV the Holy Raymond Berenger IV of Barcelona (1113-1162)[Pedigree] great(25) grand father To Aragon thereafter

and Leon (1199-1252). 1312-1350 Alphonse XI the Just Alfonso XI "el Justo" of Castile (1311-1350)[Pedigree] third cousin 20 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). (Burgundy-) Trastamara 1366-1367 Henry II the Bastard (-1379) Henry_II (Enrique) of Castile and Leon (1333-1379)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 19 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). Burgundy 1367-1369 Peter the Cruel (restored) Trastamara 1369-1379 Henry II the Bastard (restored) 1379-1390 John I Juan I of Castile (1358-1390)[Pedigree] third cousin 20 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1390-1406 Henry III the Infirm Henry_III "the Infirm" of Castile and Leon (1379-1406)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 19 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1406-1454 John II John_II (Juan_II) of Castile (1405-1454)[Pedigree] first cousin 18 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). 1454-1474 Henry IV the Impotent 1474-1504 Isabella I Isabella I of Castile (1451-1504)[Pedigree] second cousin 17 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). HABSBURG 1504-1506 Philip I Philip I "the Handsome" of Castile (1478-1506)[Pedigree] ninth cousin 19 times removed through their ancestor Berthold V (Adalbert) von Andechs Count of Andechs (1122-1188). 1506-1516 Charles I (-1558) Carlos I of Spain (1500-1558)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 15 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). Unified with Aragon to form Spain

JIMENEZ 905-926 Sancho I Sancho I Garces of Navarre & Pamplona (865-925)[Pedigree] great(32) grand father 926-970 Garcia II Garcia III Sanchez of Navarre (919-970)[Pedigree] great(31) grand father 970-992 Sancho II Sancho II Abarca of Navarre (935-994)[Pedigree] great(30) grand father 992-1000 Garcia III Garcia IV Sanchez of Navarre (964-999)[Pedigree] great(29) grand father 1000-1035 Sancho III the Great Sancho Garcie III "the Great" of Navarre (990-1035)[Pedigree] great(28) grand father 1035-1054 Garcia IV Garcia V "el de Najera" of Navarre (1020-1054)[Pedigree] great(28) grand father 1054-1076 Sancho IV Sancho IV "el Penalen" of Navarre (1039-1076)[Pedigree] great(28) uncle through their ancestor Garcia V "el de Najera" of Navarre King of Navarre (1020-1054). 1076-1094 Sancho V Sancho Ramirez I de Aragon (V de Navarre) (1042-1094)[Pedigree] great(27) grand father 1094-1104 Peter Pedro I of Aragon and Navarre (1069-1104)[Pedigree] great(27) uncle through their ancestor Sancho Ramirez I de Aragon (V de Navarre) King of Aragon (1042-1094). 1104-1134 Alphonse the Battler Alfonso I of Aragon (-1134)[Pedigree] not directly related. 1134-1150 Garcia V the Restorer Garcia V "el Restaurador" of Navarre (1110-1150)[Pedigree] great(25) grand father 1150-1194 Sancho VI the Wise Sancho VI "the Wise" of Navarre (1132-1194)[Pedigree] great(25) grand father 1194-1234 Sancho VII the Strong Sancho VII "el Fuerte" of Navarre (1170-1234)[Pedigree] great(25) uncle through their ancestor Sancho VI "the Wise" of Navarre King of Navarre (1132-1194). CHAMPAGNE 1234-1253 Theobald I Theobald I of Navarre (1201-1253)[Pedigree] great(23) grand father 1253-1270 Theobald II 1270-1274 Henry I Henry I of Navarre (-1276)[Pedigree] great(22) grand father 1274-1304 Jeanne I Jeanne of_Navarre (1272-1305)[Pedigree] great(21) grand mother CAPET 1304-1314 Louis the Stubborn (-1316) Louis_X the_Headstrong (1289-1316)[Pedigree] great(21) uncle through their ancestor Philip_IV the_Fair King of France (1268-1314). 1314-1322 Philip Philip_V the_Tall (1294-1322)[Pedigree] great(21) uncle through their ancestor Philip_IV the_Fair King of France (1268-1314). 1322-1328 Charles I Charles_IV the_Fair (1294-1328)[Pedigree] great(21) uncle through their ancestor Philip_IV the_Fair King of France (1268-1314). 1328-1349 Jeanne II EVREUX 1349-1387 Charles II the Bad 1387-1425 Charles III the Noble 1425-1441 Blanche TRASTAMARA 1425-1479 with John I Juan_II of Aragon and Navarre (1398-1479)[Pedigree] fifth cousin 18 times removed through their ancestor Fernando III "the Saint" of Castile King of Castile and Leon (1199-1252). 1479 Eleanor De GRAILLY 1479-1483 Francis Phoebus 1483-1512 Catherine (-1517) D' ALBRET 1483-1512 with John II (-1516) Spanish Navarre seized by Spain What follows is the succession of French Navarre, a tiny fragment of territory based at Pau, in the Department of Bearn. De GRAILLY (1483-)1512-1517 with Catherine D' ALBRET (1483-)1512-1516 with John II 1516-1555 and then with Henry II 1555-1572 Jeanne III CAPET-BOURBON 1555-1562 with Anthony Antoine of Navarre (1518-1562)[Pedigree] seventh cousin 15 times removed through their ancestor Jean_II d'Avesnes Count of Hainaut & Holland (1247-1304). 1562-1610 and then Henry III Henry_IV the_Great (1553-1610)[Pedigree] eighth cousin 14 times removed through their ancestor Jean_II d'Avesnes Count of Hainaut & Holland (1247-1304). Henry III succeeded to the throne of France in 1589; French Navarre enters into personal union with France thereafter.

SOBRARBRE

JIMENEZ 1035-1039 Gonzalo Gonzalo of Sobrarbe (-1045)[Pedigree] great(28) uncle through their ancestor Sancho Garcie III "the Great" of Navarre King of Navarre, Castile, and Aragon (990-1035). To Castile

Conquest by the Caliphate Fragmented into dozens of local states, both Muslim and Christian; an era dominated by the Reconquista, the attempt by Christian successors to the old Visigoth Kingdom to reclaim their patrimony. A general overview of the various phases of Mulim occupation is as follows: o Era of the Universal Caliphate...............712-755 o Era of al-Andalus............................755-1009 o First Era of Fragmentation..................1009-1091 o First Moroccan (Almoravid) Era..............1091-1145 o Second Era of Fragmentation.................1145-1150 o Second Moraccan (Almohad) Era...............1150-1228 o Third Era of Fragmentation..................1224-1249 o Granadan Twilight...........................1249-1492 HABSBURG 1516-1556 Charles I (-1558) Carlos I of Spain (1500-1558)[Pedigree] fourth cousin 15 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). 1556-1598 Philip II Philip_II of Spain (1527-1598)[Pedigree] fifth cousin 14 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). 1598-1621 Philip III Philip_III (1578-1621)[Pedigree] sixth cousin 13 times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). 1621-1665 Philip IV Philip_IV of Spain (1605-1665)[Pedigree] seventh cousin twelve times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398). 1665-1700 Charles II Carlos II "the Bewitched" of Spain (1661-1700)[Pedigree] eighth cousin eleven times removed through their ancestor John of_Gaunt Duke of Lancaster (1340-1398).
